How it works

Image Generation works with the Generative Adversial Networks

Generative Adversial Networks

Creating the GAN Model

Generative Adversial Networks

To generate - basically - anything with machine learning, you have to use a generative algorithm, and at least for now, one of the most powerful generative algorithms for image generation is Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs).

The rough structure of the GAN

In a common GAN structure, two agents compete with each other: a generator and a discriminator.
They can be designed using different networks (e.g. Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) or simply Regular Neural Networks (ANNs or RegularNets).
Since we will be generating images, CNNs are better suited for this task Therefore we will build our agents with Convolutional Neural Networks.

Creating the GAN Model

GANs often use computationally complex calculations, and therefore GPU-enabled machines will make your life much easier.
Therefore, one can use Google Colab to reduce training time with GPU acceleration.
